definition: triad, Chinese crime gang/triad society, anti-Manchu secret society in Qing-dynasty China
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: Mr. Tao also invited the triads to set up businesses in China.
sentences.chinese: 陶駟駒還邀請三合會到大陸投資設廠。

sentences.english: Throughout the year, the fight against triads and organised criminal syndicates continued.
sentences.chinese: 年內，警方繼續打擊三合會及有組織犯罪集團。

sentences.english: They have their cosa nostra, we have our triads.
sentences.chinese: 他們有黑手黨，我們有三合會。

sentences.english: Investigates complex organised crime and serious triad offences.
sentences.chinese: 調查複雜的有組織罪案和嚴重的三合會罪行。

definition: the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
to recruit talent/to round up/to enlist the services of sb
Edward Snowden (1983-), American surveillance program whistleblower
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
to break up the whole into pieces (idiom); dealing with things one by one/divide and conquer
